sect1.title: Creating and editing user accounts
sect1.para: Required fields are marked with a red asterisk (*).

simplelist.member:
Account name:
Used to store real name or description of the account

User login:
Used to identify user when logging in

Default Qual/Catalog:
Default qualifier and catalog for the user

Password:
User password. Same string must be entered in both Password and Confirm password fields to detect typing errors.

User enabled:
This is a master enable/disable switch. If unchecked, the user will not be able to log into the system in any capacity

Allow SQL/ODBC logins:
Controls whether the user is allowed to login using a database client, such as a standalone interactive SQL CLI or an ODBC client.

Primary role:
User primary role (group) in the system. Controls role-based grants to DB objects. WebDAV resources and collections created by the user will have their group owner set as this group by default.

Account roles:
Additional roles (groups) the user is a member of.

Email:
User email for administrative and other purposes

DAV home path:
User home in WebDAV file server

Default permissions:
Default permissions flags for resources uploaded by the user into WebDAV file server. The permission flags are as in UNIX™-like systems - read-write-execute by user, group and others. The additional t flag controls free-text indexing.

Quota:
User quota (bytes) in WebDAV file server. Has no effect if quotas are not enabled. To enable DAV quotas, you need to set the DAVQuotaEnabled parameter in virtuoso ini file to a non-zero value.
